sentence1: Computers are very efficient at manipulating large amounts of data./manipulating*_______________ing
translation1: 컴퓨터는 많은 양의 데이터를 처리하는 데 아주 효율적이다.

korean: ① a. 손으로 하는, 수동의, 육체노동의 ② n. (조작법) 설명[안내]서
sentence1: People in manual jobs are more likely to be physically injured at work./manual*_______________
translation1: 육체노동 일을 하는 사람들은 일을 하다가 신체적으로 부상을 입을 가능성이 더 많다.

korean: ① n. (제조) 공장, 생산 설비 ② n. 식물 v. (식물·씨앗을) 심다
sentence1: The assembly plant produces more than 500 passenger cars a day./plant*_______________
translation1: 그 조립 공장은 하루에 500대 이상의 승용차를 생산한다.

sentence1: My father is a mechanic. He repairs cars in his repair shop./mechanic*_______________
translation1: 내 아버지는 수리공이다. 그는 정비소에서 자동차를 고친다.

sentence1: This device enables four images to be viewed on one screen at the same time./device*_______________
translation1: 이 장치는 네 개의 이미지를 한 화면에서 동시에 볼 수 있게 한다.

sentence1: Firemen wearing breathing apparatus entered the store which was filled with smoke./apparatus*_______________
translation1: 산소 호흡기를 착용한 소방관들이 연기로 가득한 상점으로 들어갔다.

korean: ① n. (정밀한 작은) 기구, 도구 ② n. 악기
sentence1: Surgical instruments are made in a vast number of types./instruments*_______________s
translation1: 외과 수술 기구는 엄청나게 많은 종류로 만들어진다.

korean: ① n. (야외 활동용 간단한) 도구, 기구 ② v. (행동으로 옮겨) 실행[이행]하다
sentence1: The farmers used only traditional agricultural implements./implements*_______________s
translation1: 그 농부들은 전통적인 농기구만을 사용했다.

korean: ① v. 발명[고안]하다 ② v. (사실인 것처럼) 날조[조작]하다
sentence1: The first motion picture was invented by Edison in 1889./invented*_______________ed
translation1: 첫 번째 활동 사진은 1889년 에디슨에 의해 발명되었다.

korean: n. 특허(권) a. 특허(권)의 v. ~의 특허를 주다
sentence1: Legally a machine can be protected by patent for 20 years./patent*_______________
translation1: 기계는 법적으로 20년 동안 특허권으로 보호를 받을 수 있다.

sentence1: Edison invented the light bulb and was a pioneer in the field of electricity./pioneer*_______________
translation1: 에디슨은 전구를 발명했으며 전기 분야의 선구자이었다.

sentence1: We must consider how best to utilize limited resources to maximize profits./utilize*_______________
translation1: 우리는 이익 극대화를 위해 한정된 자원을 어떻게 가장 잘 활용할 것인가를 생각해야 한다.

korean: ① v. 채용[채택, 차용]하다 ② v. 입양하다
sentence1: The English language has adopted words from many other languages./adopted*_______________ed
translation1: 영어는 많은 다른 언어에서 단어를 차용해왔다.

korean: ① v. 남용하다 n. 남용 ② v. 학대하다 n. 학대
sentence1: He has repeatedly abused his authority as mayor./abused*_______________d
translation1: 그는 시장으로서의 권한을 반복적으로 남용해 왔다.

korean: ① v. (권력·영향력·압력을) 쓰다, 행사하다 ② v. (~ oneself) 열심히 노력하다
sentence1: He exerted all his authority to make them change their decision./exerted*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 그들이 결정을 바꾸도록 하기 위해 그의 모든 권한을 행사했다.

korean: ① v. (권력·권리·역량을) 행사[발휘]하다 n. 행사, 발휘 ② n. 운동 v. 운동하다 ③ n. 연습 (문제), 훈련
sentence1: He exercised his right as a voter by voting at the election./exercised*_______________d
translation1: 그는 선거에서 투표를 함으로써 유권자로서의 권리를 행사했다.

sentence1: After the party, please put everything back in its proper place./proper*_______________
translation1: 파티가 끝난 후에 모든 것을 제자리에 돌려놓으십시오.

korean: ① a. 적당한, 알맞은, 제대로 된 ② a. 예의 바른, 단정한
sentence1: I haven't had a decent meal in nearly two days./decent*_______________
translation1: 나는 거의 이틀 동안 제대로 된 식사를 하지 못했다.

sentence1: T-shirts and jeans are not appropriate for a wedding./appropriate*_______________
translation1: 티셔츠와 청바지는 결혼식장에는 적절하지 않다.

korean: ① a. (발언·묘사·선택 등이) 적절한 ② a. (선천적·본질적으로) ~하기 쉬운, ~하는 경향이 있는
sentence1: That is a very apt description of the situation./apt*_______________
translation1: 그것은 그 상황에 매우 적절한 묘사이다.

korean: ① a. 실용적인 ② a. 실제[현실]적인
sentence1: The boots she wore were practical rather than stylish./practical*_______________
translation1: 그녀가 신은 부츠는 유행을 따른 것이기 보다는 실용적인 것이었다.

sentence1: The meeting was very constructive and I got a lot of valuable information./constructive*_______________
translation1: 회의는 매우 건설적이었고 나는 많은 귀중한 정보를 얻었다.

korean: n. 고장, 기능 부전 v. 제대로 기능[작동]하지 않다
sentence1: An engine malfunction caused the plane to crash into the sea./malfunction*_______________
translation1: 엔진의 기능 장애로 인해 그 비행기는 바다로 추락했다.

sentence1: He had his car repaired in an auto repair shop./repaired*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 한 자동차 정비소에 그의 차 수리를 맡겼다.

korean: ① v. (고장·파손된 것을) 수리[수선]하다 ② v. (옷을) 수선하다 n. 수선한 부분
sentence1: He climbed up a ladder to mend the roof of the house./mend*_______________
translation1: 그는 그 집의 지붕을 수선하기 위해 사다리를 올라갔다.

sentence1: We will have to renovate the building because it’s in terrible condition./renovate*_______________
translation1: 건물 상태가 매우 안 좋기 때문에 우리는 건물을 수리해야 한다.

sentence1: The company is a multinational corporation that operates in 21 countries./corporation*_______________
translation1: 그 회사는 21개국에서 영업을 하는 다국적 기업이다.
sentence2: A corporation is considered an individual in the eyes of the law./corporation*_______________
translation2: 법인은 법률상으로는 하나의 개인으로 여겨진다.

korean: n. 기업(체), 회사; 모험적인 사업[기획, 계획]
sentence1: Small and medium-sized enterprises are the backbone of the economy./enterprises*_______________s
translation1: 중소기업은 경제의 근간이다.
sentence2: This is a joint enterprise with America and several European nations./enterprise*_______________
translation2: 이것은 미국과 유럽의 여러 국가가 함께 하는 공동 사업이다.

korean: ① n. (소규모) 회사, 상사 ② a. (물체가) 굳은, 단단한 ③ a. (토대·태도·신념이) 확고[확실]한
sentence1: Despite her outstanding academic record, she could not get a job with a law firm./firm*_______________
translation1: 뛰어난 학업성적에도 불구하고 그녀는 법률사무소에서 일자리를 구할 수가 없었다.

sentence1: In 1995, the World Trade Organization was established to promote free trade./established*_______________ed
translation1: 세계 무역 기구는 자유 무역을 증진하기 위해 1995년에 설립되었다.

sentence1: The university was founded by the Roman Catholics in 1832./founded*_______________ed
translation1: 그 대학은 1832년 천주교 신자들에 의해 창립되었다.
sentence2: The Australian legal system is founded on the British system./founded*_______________ed
translation2: 호주의 법률 제도는 영국의 제도를 기반으로 하고 있다.

korean: ① v. (단체를) 설립[설치]하다 ② v. 구성하다, 이루다
sentence1: The Human Rights Committee was constituted in 2011 and meets monthly./constituted*_______________d
translation1: 그 인권 위원회는 2011년 설립되었고 매달 모임을 갖는다.

korean: ① v. (지위·임무를 맡도록) 임명[지명]하다 ② v. (시간·장소를) 정하다, 지정하다
sentence1: Mr. Johnson was appointed as chairman of the newly elected committee./appointed*_______________ed
translation1: 존슨씨가 새로 선출된 위원회의 회장으로 임명되었다.

korean: ① v. 승진[진급]시키다 ② v. 촉진[고취, 판촉]하다
sentence1: Two years later, she was promoted from assistant manager to manager./promoted*_______________d
translation1: 2년 후 그녀는 대리에서 과장으로 승진했다.

korean: n. 부하, 하급자 a. 부차[부수]적인; 종속된
sentence1: The manager usually consults with his subordinates before making decisions./subordinates*_______________s
translation1: 그 관리자는 결정을 하기 전에 그의 하급자들과 대개 상의를 한다.
sentence2: All other rules and regulations are subordinate to this principle./subordinate*_______________
translation2: 다른 모든 규칙과 규정은 이 원칙에 비해 부차적이다.

sentence1: Harry and I work together in the same office. He is my colleague./colleague*_______________
translation1: 해리와 나는 같은 사무실에서 함께 일한다. 그는 나의 동료이다.

sentence1: Her job was to supervise thirty-five employees, mostly women in their early twenties./supervise*_______________
translation1: 그녀의 일은 대부분 20대 초반의 여성인 35명의 종업원들을 감독하는 것이었다.

korean: ① v. 운영[관리, 집행]하다 ② v. (약을) 투여[투약]하다
sentence1: The fund will be administered by a committee appointed by the management./administered*_______________ed
translation1: 그 기금은 경영진이 임명한 위원회에 의해 운영될 것이다.

korean: ① n. 이사회, 위원회 ② n. 널빤지, 판자, ~판[반, 대] ③ v. 타다, 탑승[승선]하다 ④ v. 하숙[기숙]하다; 학교 기숙사에서 살다 n. (숙박업소의) 식사(비)
sentence1: The final budget was formally approved by the board of directors in December./board*_______________
translation1: 최종 예산은 12월에 이사회에서 정식으로 승인되었다.

korean: ① n. 노동조합 ② n. 결합, 통합, 연합
sentence1: In 2013, 55 percent of all new teachers joined the union, while in 2012 only 15 percent did./union*_______________
translation1: 2012년에 모든 새 교사들의 15퍼센트만이 노조에 가입한 반면 2013년에는 55퍼센트가 가입했다.

korean: ① n. 직업 ② n. 점령, 점거 ③ n. 사용, 거주
sentence1: Please state your name, age, sex and occupation in the box below./occupation*_______________
translation1: 당신의 성명, 나이, 성별, 직업을 아래의 박스에 기술하십시오.

sentence1: He regards his work as a vocation, not just a job./vocation*_______________
translation1: 그는 자신의 일을 단순한 직업이 아니라 천직으로 여긴다.

korean: v. (새로운 사람들을) 모집하다 n. 신입 사원[회원]
sentence1: He is responsible for recruiting and training new staff./recruiting*_______________ing
translation1: 그는 새로운 직원을 모집하고 교육하는 일을 책임지고 있다.

korean: ① v. (일자리·회사·대학에) 지원하다; (허가·증명서를) 신청하다 ② v. 적용[응용]하다 ③ v. (크림·연고·페인트를) 바르다
sentence1: She's applied for a job with a small software company./applied*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 작은 소프트웨어 회사의 일자리에 지원했다.
sentence2: I have applied for a new passport but have not received it yet./applied*_______________ed
translation2: 나는 새로운 여권을 신청했지만 아직 받지 못했다.

korean: ① n. 이력서 ② v. 다시 시작하다[되다], 재개하다[되다]
sentence1: He sent his résumé to 70 companies, but did not get a single interview./résumé*_______________
translation1: 그는 70 군데의 회사에 이력서를 보냈지만 단 한 군데도 면접을 보지 못했다.

sentence1: The company employs about 50,000 people in over 120 countries./employs*_______________s
translation1: 그 회사는 120 이상의 나라에 5만 명의 사람을 고용하고 있다.

korean: ① v. (한시적으로) 고용하다 ② v. (물품을) 빌리다, 임차하다; (~ out) 빌려주다, 임대하다 n. (물품의) 임차, 빌림
sentence1: He hired a lawyer to defend him in court but lost the case./hired*_______________d
translation1: 그는 자신을 법정에서 변호해줄 변호사를 고용했으나 소송에서 패했다.

sentence1: He resigned from the company to start his own business./resigned*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 자신의 사업을 시작하기 위해 회사를 사직했다.

sentence1: He retired last month after 25 years with the company./retired*_______________d
translation1: 그는 그 회사와 함께 25년을 보낸 후 지난 달 퇴직했다.

korean: ① v. 해고[해임]하다 ② v. 물러가게 하다, 해산시키다 ③ v. 묵살[일축]하다; (생각 등을) 버리다
sentence1: He claimed that he had been unfairly dismissed from his post./dismissed*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 자신의 직위에서 부당에서 해고당했다고 주장했다.

sentence1: The workers are fighting for higher wages and better working conditions./wages*_______________s
translation1: 그 노동자들은 임금 인상과 근로 조건 개선을 요구하며 싸우고 있다.

sentence1: The purpose of this meeting is to discuss ways in which we can increase sales./purpose*_______________
translation1: 이 회의의 목적은 우리가 판매를 늘릴 수 있는 방법을 논의하는 데 있다.

korean: ① n. 목표 v. 목표로 삼다 ② v. (목표물을 향해) 겨누다, 겨냥하다 n. 겨냥, 조준
sentence1: Her main aim in life was to find the right guy with enough money to keep her happy./aim*_______________
translation1: 그녀의 인생의 목표는 자신을 행복하게 해줄 충분한 돈을 가진 괜찮은 남자를 찾는 것이다.

sentence1: The doctor advised him to stop smoking for the sake of his health./sake*_______________
translation1: 의사는 그에게 건강을 위해서 담배를 끊으라고 조언했다.
sentence2: It was a great sacrifice for me but I did it for his sake./sake*_______________
translation2: 그것은 나에 게는 커다란 희생이었으나 나는 그것을 그를 위해서 했다.

korean: n. 계획, 기획, 안 v. 계획[입안]하다; n. 음모, 계략 v. 음모를 꾸미다
sentence1: This scheme is designed to encourage growth and development in the region./scheme*_______________
translation1: 이 계획은 그 지역의 성장과 발정을 촉진하기 위해 만들어졌다.
sentence2: Big corporations are using increasingly complicated schemes to avoid paying taxes./schemes*_______________s
translation2: 대기업은 납세를 회피하기 위해 점점 더 복잡한 계략을 쓰고 있다.

sentence1: A company's business strategy is critical to its success./strategy*_______________
translation1: 한 회사의 사업 전략은 그것의 성공에 대단히 중요하다.

korean: ① n. 계략, 음모 v. 음모하다 ② n. 줄거리 v. 줄거리를 세우다
sentence1: The plot was discovered before it could be carried out./plot*_______________
translation1: 그 음모는 실행도 되기 전에 발각되었다.

korean: ① n. 기능 v. (제대로) 기능하다 ② n. (수학의) 함수
sentence1: This new MP3 player has more functions than the old one./functions*_______________s
translation1: 이 새로운 MP3플레이어는 이전 것보다 더 많은 기능을 가지고 있다.

sentence1: Universities play an important role in the development of science and technology./role*_______________
translation1: 대학은 과학과 기술의 발전에 중요한 역할을 한다.
sentence2: He played the role of a young teacher in the movie./role*_______________
translation2: 그는 영화에서 한 젊은 교사의 배역을 했다.

sentence1: You can save a lot of time by using this method./method*_______________
translation1: 이 방법을 사용하면 많은 시간을 절약할 수 있습니다.

korean: ① n. 접근[처리] 방법 v. (일·문제에) 접근[착수]하다 ② v. 접근하다, 다가가다 n. 접근
sentence1: We need to take a more scientific approach to the problem./approach*_______________
translation1: 우리는 그 문제에 대해 좀 더 과학적인 접근법을 취할 필요가 있다.

sentence1: It is a change of tactics rather than strategy./tactics*_______________s
translation1: 그것은 전략이라기보다는 전술의 변화이다.

sentence1: You can do it alone, if you know the correct procedure./procedure*_______________
translation1: 올바른 절차를 안다면 그것을 혼자서도 할 수 있습니다.

korean: ① n. 과정 ② v. (절차에 따라) 처리하다; (원자재·식품을) 가공하다 n. 공정
sentence1: Writing a book such as this is a long and difficult process./process*_______________
translation1: 이러한 책을 집필하는 것은 길고 어려운 과정이다.

korean: ① v. 준비[마련]하다[해 주다] ② v. 배열[정돈]하다
sentence1: The next meeting has been arranged for Thursday, February 14th./arranged*_______________d
translation1: 다음 회의는 2월14일 목요일에 하기로 정해졌다.

sentence1: I'm willing to help you with whatever you need. Just tell me what you need./willing*_______________
translation1: 필요하신 것은 무엇이든지 기꺼이 도와드리겠습니다. 필요한 것을 말씀만 해 주세요.

sentence1: Computers can organize and store vast amounts of information./organize*_______________
translation1: 컴퓨터는 엄청난 양의 정보를 체계화하고 저장할 수 있다.
sentence2: She’s organized lots of fun activities for the children./organized*_______________d
translation2: 그녀는 아이들을 위하여 많은 즐거운 놀이를 준비했다.

korean: ① n. (특정한) 장소, 지점 ② v. 찾아내다, 발견하다 ③ n. (작고 둥근) 점, 반점; (피부의) 발진; 얼룩, 더럼
sentence1: Many species of birds return to the same spot year after year./spot*_______________

sentence1: District 4 is one of the poorest school districts in the city./District*_______________

sentence1: This train is bound for Boston via New York City./bound*_______________

sentence1: The police officers pursued him, yelling at him to stop./pursued*_______________d

sentence1: Police trailed the suspect for six months prior to his arrest./trailed*_______________ed

sentence1: The hunters tracked bears with specially trained dogs./tracked*_______________ed

sentence1: The company's head office was transferred from London to Manchester./transferred*_______________ed

sentence1: Many workers migrate in search of better jobs and higher wages./migrate*_______________

korean: ① v. 입장을 허락하다; 입회[입학]를 허락하다 ② v. 인정하다 ③ v. (병원에) 입원시키다

korean: ① v. (억지로) 쑤셔 넣다, 비집고 들어가다 ② v. 꽉 쥐다[죄다] n. 꽉 쥐기 v. 짜다, 짜내다 n. 짜내기

korean: ① v. 나아가다, 전진하다; (시간이) 경과하다 n. 전진 ② v. (일이) 진행[진척]되다 n. 진행, 진척

korean: ① v. 나아가다, 이동하다 ② v. 계속 진행하다[되다]; 계속해서[이어서] ~을 하다

sentence1: The United States withdrew its troops from Vietnam in1973./withdrew*_______________

sentence1: The army was heavily attacked and forced to retreat./retreat*_______________

korean: ① v. 떨어지다[뜨리다], 내던(져)지다, 뛰어들다 ② n. (갑자기) 떨어짐, 추락, 뛰어듦

sentence1: Blood circulates throughout the whole body./circulates*_______________s

sentence1: The ball rolled slowly toward third base and stopped./rolled*_______________ed

sentence1: The prison was enclosed by a high stone wall./enclosed*_______________d

sentence1: The kitchen door swung open and closed as waiters passed in and out./swung*_______________

sentence2: He swung his bat and hit the ball high into the air towards the left field./swung*_______________

sentence1: The young mother gently rocked her baby back and forth in her arms./rocked*_______________ed

sentence1: Her entire body swayed like a tree as the wind blew against her./swayed*_______________ed

sentence1: The dog wagged its tail and licked her face with a rough tongue./wagged*_______________ed

sentence1: The dance floor was vibrating to the steady beat of the drums./vibrating*_______________ing

korean: ① v. 타다, 탑승[승선]하다 ② n. 널빤지, 판자, ~판[반, 대] ③ n. 이사회, 위원회 ④ v. 하숙[기숙]하다; 학교 기숙사에서 살다 n. (숙박업소의) 식사(비)
sentence1: Flight BA 901 to Boston is now boarding at Gate 15./boarding*_______________ing

sentence1: There was a narrow alley between the two buildings./alley*_______________

korean: ① n. 길, 오솔길; 철도 선로; 경주로, 트랙 ② n. (-s) 자국, 자취 ③ v. (자취·행적을 쫓아) 추적하다, 뒤쫓다
sentence1: The track led through a jungle up to the lake./track*_______________

sentence1: The driver changed lanes unnecessarily to the left or to the right./lanes*_______________s

sentence1: Go straight and turn right at the first intersection./intersection*_______________

sentence1: The sidewalk was so icy she slipped again when she tried to stand./sidewalk*_______________

sentence1: Children walking to school should cross only at the crosswalks./crosswalks*_______________s

sentence1: Last night a pedestrian was hit by a car while crossing a street./pedestrian*_______________

sentence1: He stopped his car and asked a passer-by the way to the nearest hotel./passer-by*_______________

sentence1: Landing a spacecraft on the moon was a great achievement for mankind./spacecraft*_______________

sentence1: Fortunately, none of the passengers and crew on board were hurt./crew*_______________

sentence1: Neil Armstrong was the first astronaut to walk on the surface of the moon./astronaut*_______________

korean: ① v. (새·비행기가) 날아오르다, 치솟다 ② v. 급등[급증, 급상승]하다
sentence1: The bird spread its wings and soared into the sky and joined the flock./soared*_______________ed

sentence1: The vessel changed course and headed for the shore./vessel*_______________

sentence1: This ferry carries passengers and vehicles to the other side of the lake./ferry*_______________

sentence1: Nuclear submarines can stay under water for months without having to surface./submarines*_______________s

sentence1: For three days and nights they had floated in a raft in the Pacific Ocean./raft*_______________

sentence1: We went up on deck to watch the stars come out over the quiet sea./deck*_______________

sentence1: Until the 1400s, most ships in Europe had one mast and one big, square sail./mast*_______________

sentence1: At night, the Vikings navigated by the stars./navigated*_______________d

korean: v. (물 위나 공중을) 떠다니다, 떠돌다 n. 떠다니기

sentence2: Of the two, I prefer the former to the latter, but they're both pretty good./former*_______________

korean: ① a. 미리[앞서서] 하는, 사전의 n. 선금, 선불 ② v. 향상[진보]되다[시키다] n. 향상, 진보 ③ v. 전진[진격]하다 n. 전진, 진격
sentence1: I'll give you advance notice of any changes and post updates to the class web page./advance*_______________

sentence1: You should have told me beforehand and I would have considered it./beforehand*_______________

korean: a. 예비[준비]의 n. 예비 행위[단계], 서두, (스포츠의) 예선전
sentence1: The preliminary rounds of the competition will take place on Friday./preliminary*_______________

sentence1: The 2-day event will be preceded by an orientation for new students./preceded*_______________d

sentence2: See the preceding chapter for further details./preceding*_______________ing

sentence1: Let's not make any premature conclusion at this stage./premature*_______________

sentence1: A few days later I had coffee with her and she gave me a belated birthday present./belated*_______________

sentence1: Because of the rain, the game was postponed until tomorrow./postponed*_______________d
translation1: 비 때문에 경기가 내일로 연기되었다.

korean: v. (사정상 또는 일부러) 미루다, 연기하다 n. 미룸, 연기; 지연, 지체
sentence1: The plane was delayed for five hours because of bad weather./delayed*_______________ed

sentence1: The dancers’ motions were perfectly synchronized with each other./synchronized*_______________d

korean: ① v. (우연히) 동시에 일어나다 ② v. 일치하다

sentence1: The meeting was conducted in French with simultaneous translation into English./simultaneous*_______________

sentence1: The book was an instant success when it was published./instant*_______________

sentence1: He was always very punctual for appointments./punctual*_______________

sentence1: The submission deadline for applications is Monday, March 28, 2011./deadline*_______________

sentence1: The arrows show the sequence in which the tasks must be performed./sequence*_______________

sentence2: The sequence of events leading up to this decision remains unclear./sequence*_______________

sentence1: Details of these techniques will be dealt with in a subsequent chapter./subsequent*_______________

sentence1: It is probably too early to predict what the eventual outcome will be./eventual*_______________

sentence1: The company launched an advertising campaign to promote its new product./launched*_______________ed

sentence2: The company is planning to launch a new product later this year./launch*_______________

sentence1: The newly elected government has initiated a program of educational reform./initiated*_______________d

sentence1: Greece is often regarded as the cradle of Western civilization./cradle*_______________

sentence2: My baby is sleeping in the cradle at the side of my bed./cradle*_______________

sentence1: With the advent of the Internet, consumers are much more powerful than ever./advent*_______________

sentence1: The present contract terminates at the end of this year./terminates*_______________s

sentence1: He concluded the speech by thanking everyone for coming./concluded*_______________d

sentence1: In 1865, slavery was abolished in the United States./abolished*_______________ed

sentence1: In France, the President has the power to dissolve Parliament./dissolve*_______________

sentence1: The captain ordered his soldiers to cease fire, but they continued to shoot./cease*_______________

sentence1: Your driver's license will be suspended until the fine is paid./suspended*_______________ed

sentence1: The Labor Party withdrew its support for the government at the last minute./withdrew*_______________

sentence2: If the pain persists consult your doctor and get your throat fully examined./persists*_______________s

sentence1: Ten days later the German army renewed its attack on Moscow./renewed*_______________ed

sentence2: Her driver's license expired and she hasn't renewed it./renewed*_______________ed

sentence1: Today people live in perpetual fear of losing their jobs./perpetual*_______________

sentence1: Sheep are the most helpless animals and need constant care and attention./constant*_______________

korean: ① a. 꾸준한, 한결 같은 ② a. 고정적인, 한결 같은, 안정된 v. 안정[고정, 진정]되다[시키다]
sentence1: This book has been a steady seller for nearly thirty years./steady*_______________

sentence1: When the natural habitats of the animals are destroyed, many of them will die./habitats*_______________s

sentence1: He is very familiar with the geography of the area./geography*_______________

sentence1: The climate of the Arctic is characterized by long, cold winters and short, cool summers./Arctic*_______________

sentence1: Kenya is a wonderful country that lies on the equator in East Africa./equator*_______________

sentence1: More than two thirds of the land surface is in the northern hemisphere./hemisphere*_______________

sentence1: Nearly 35 percent of the French urban population is living in Paris./urban*_______________

sentence1: My office is in downtown Boston, but I live in the suburbs./suburbs*_______________s

sentence1: The university is located on the outskirts of the western part of the city./outskirts*_______________

sentence1: He was the first African American to be elected mayor of New York City./mayor*_______________

sentence1: They want to live a traditional rural lifestyle without modern conveniences./rural*_______________

sentence1: The cosmos is a direct expression of God's own being./cosmos*_______________

sentence1: It is highly likely that intelligent life exists on other planets./planets*_______________s

korean: ① n. 대기, 공기; (특정 장소의) 공기 ② n. (대상이나 주변의) 분위기
sentence1: Burning coal pollutes the atmosphere, creates acid rain and leads to climate change./atmosphere*_______________

sentence1: The Moon is a satellite of Earth, the planet we live on./satellite*_______________

sentence2: The championship was broadcast live by satellite around the world./satellite*_______________

sentence1: A bright comet with a long tail appeared in the night sky./comet*_______________

sentence1: The solar system belongs to the galaxy called the Milky Way./galaxy*_______________

sentence1: The satellite went into orbit as planned, 25 minutes after launch./orbit*_______________

sentence1: The apple falls from the tree to the earth because of the force of gravity./gravity*_______________

sentence1: The solar system has nine planets, including Earth./solar*_______________

sentence1: Even today, the Lunar New Year's Day is still a major holiday in Korea./Lunar*_______________

sentence1: Astronomy deals with the motion and character of heavenly bodies./Astronomy*_______________

sentence1: Geology is the study of the formation and composition of the earth./Geology*_______________
translation1: 지질학은 지구의 형성과 구성을 연구하는 학문이다.

sentence1: The earthquake destroyed most of the buildings in the downtown area./earthquake*_______________

sentence1: Every bride would wish to wear an exquisite wedding dress on her big day./exquisite*_______________

korean: ① a. (물체가) 굳은, 단단한 ② a. (토대·태도·신념이) 확고[확실]한 ③ n. (소규모) 회사, 상사
sentence1: Doctors advise sleeping on a firm mattress to prevent backaches./firm*_______________

sentence1: It was frozen solid as a rock and hard to cut./solid*_______________

sentence2: The company offers very flexible working hours./flexible*_______________

sentence1: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is leaning a little more each year./leaning*_______________ing

sentence1: This pencil is blunt. I cannot write with it./blunt*_______________

sentence1: It's hard to guess her age because she dyes her hair./dyes*_______________s

sentence1: He was dressed in faded blue jeans and a T-shirt./faded*_______________d

korean: ① n. 특징, 특색 v. (~의) 특징을 이루다, ~을 특색으로 삼다 ② n. 얼굴의 어느 한 부분
sentence1: The latest version of this software has several new features and is faster./features*_______________s

sentence1: One of the properties of light is that it travels in the form of waves./properties*_______________es

korean: ① n. 자질, 속성 ② v. ~의 탓[덕분]으로 돌리다
sentence1: Experience is one of the most important attributes in any business./attributes*_______________s

sentence1: What criteria are used for selecting candidates?/criteria*_______________

sentence1: The area is well known for its outstanding natural beauty./outstanding*_______________

sentence1: He has done a terrific job. I couldn't be more proud of him./terrific*_______________

sentence1: The most striking feature of the house is its design./striking*_______________

sentence1: The festival ended with a spectacular fireworks display./spectacular*_______________

sentence1: The Grand Canyon is the most majestic sight I've ever seen./majestic*_______________

sentence1: The food was absolutely superb, especially the steak./superb*_______________

korean: a. 최상(급)의, 최고급의; 첫 번째의, 가장 중요한, 주된 n. 한창때, 전성기
sentence1: Prime beef is sold primarily to the best restaurants./Prime*_______________

sentence2: The burning of fossil fuels is the prime cause of global warming./prime*_______________

korean: ① a. 심각한; (표정 등이) 심각한 ② n. 무덤, 묘(지)
sentence1: The report expressed grave concern over the present economic situation./grave*_______________

sentence1: The earthquake caused severe damage to numerous wooden houses./severe*_______________
translation1: 그 지진은 수많은 목재 건물에 심각한 피해를 입혔다.

sentence1: He had a nasty accident on his bike and was hospitalized yesterday./nasty*_______________

sentence1: The project was a huge success and surpassed all expectations./surpassed*_______________ed

sentence1: This system has two advantages: first it is quicker and second it is cheaper./advantages*_______________s

sentence1: New technological advances have brought many benefits to society./benefits*_______________s

sentence1: This is a good opportunity to enhance the company's reputation./enhance*_______________

sentence1: The government has begun to take steps to reform the education system./reform*_______________

sentence1: On the third hospital day, the patient's condition suddenly deteriorated./deteriorated*_______________d
translation1: 입원 3일째에 그 환자의 건강 상태는 갑자기 악화되었다.

sentence1: Napoleon, in June, 1812, invaded the Russian territory with a mighty force./mighty*_______________
translation1: 나폴레옹은 1812년 6월 강력한 기세로 러시아 영토를 침략했다.

sentence1: The chair is very sturdy and well made and it is very easy to assemble./sturdy*_______________
translation1: 그 의자는 매우 튼튼하게 잘 만들어졌고 조립하기가 매우 쉽다.

korean: a. (느낌·영향이) 강렬한, 깊은; (지적으로) 깊이가 있는, 심오한

sentence1: We must introduce new products in order to survive intense competition./intense*_______________

sentence1: Crystal vases are very beautiful but fragile./fragile*_______________

sentence1: The old man was too feeble to stand on his own./feeble*_______________

korean: a. 연약한, 여린, 부서지기 쉬운; 섬세한, 정교한, 미묘한, 까다로운
sentence1: She has very delicate skin that's easily damaged./delicate*_______________

sentence2: The problem is so delicate that it needs to be handled carefully./delicate*_______________

korean: ① a. 소박[수수]한, 꾸미지 않은; 평범한, (여성이) 아름답지 않은 ② a. 분명한, 명료한 ③ n. 평원, 평지
sentence1: The interior of the house was plain and simple, but elegant./plain*_______________

sentence2: She is a plain woman, but is said to have a very fine mind./plain*_______________

korean: a. 대충 만든; 천연 그대로의; 막된, 상스러운
sentence1: Crude oil prices hit their highest level in a decade./Crude*_______________
translation1: 원유 가격이 십 년 만에 가장 높은 수준으로 올랐다.
sentence2: Don’t be so crude! Where did you learn such bad language?/crude*_______________
translation2: 상스럽게 굴지마! 어디서 그런 나쁜 말을 배웠니?

korean: ① a. 복잡한 ② n. 복합 건물, (건물) 단지 ③ n. 강박관념, 콤플렉스
sentence1: For every complex problem there is a simple solution./complex*_______________

sentence1: Don't complicate the situation by adding your own poor judgment to it./complicate*_______________

korean: ① a. 정교한, 복잡한 ② a. 세련된, 교양이 있는
sentence1: Computer-based systems are becoming more and more sophisticated./sophisticated*_______________

korean: ① a. 정교한; 정성[공]을 들인 v. 정교하게 만들어 내다 ② v. 아주 자세히 설명[묘사]하다
sentence1: The floor had elaborate designs created from mosaic tiles./elaborate*_______________

sentence2: They prepared a very elaborate wedding for their only daughter./elaborate*_______________
translation2: 그들은 외동딸을 위해 매우 정성을 들인 결혼식을 준비했다.

korean: a. ~의 가치가 있는, ~할 가치가 있는 n. 가치
sentence1: The stolen diamond ring is reported to be worth two million dollars./worth*_______________

sentence1: We need to evaluate how well our products are meeting customer needs./evaluate*_______________

sentence1: The market value of the land was assessed at two million dollars./assessed*_______________ed

sentence2: It's difficult to assess exactly how these chemicals affect human health./assess*_______________
translation2: 이 화학 물질들이 인간의 건강에 정확히 어떻게 영향을 미칠지 판단하기는 어렵다.

sentence1: It is desirable that the candidate should have a high level of fluency in English./desirable*_______________

korean: v. ~할 가치[자격, 권리]가 있다, ~을 받을[당할] 만하다
sentence1: Have a nice rest; after all that hard work, you deserve it!/deserve*_______________
translation1: 푹 쉬세요. 그렇게 힘든 일을 했으니 당신은 그럴 자격이 있어요.

sentence1: There is no question that life is more precious than any other things./precious*_______________

korean: ① v. 가치가 오르다 ② v. 감사하게 생각한다 ③ v. 올바르게 인식하다, 진가를 이해하다
sentence1: The property has appreciated in value by 30% since that time./appreciated*_______________d
translation1: 그 부동산은 그때 이후로 30% 가치가 올랐다.

korean: a. 필수적인, 본질적인 n. (-s) 필수[기본]적인 것
sentence1: It’s essential to study grammar if you want to speak the language correctly./essential*_______________
translation1: 그 언어를 정확하게 구사하려면 문법을 공부하는 것이 필수적이다.

sentence1: Effective communication is vital in a large organization./vital*_______________

sentence1: The internet has now become an indispensable part of our lives./indispensable*_______________
translation1: 인터넷은 이제 우리 생활에 없어서는 안 되는 부분이 되었다

sentence1: There's a fundamental difference between joy and happiness./fundamental*_______________

sentence1: Unemployment is the underlying cause of poverty./underlying*_______________

sentence1: Every investment strategy has its own inherent risks and limitations./inherent*_______________

sentence1: There has been a significant drop in my income recently./significant*_______________
translation1: 최근 내 수입에 현저한 감소가 있었다.

korean: ① n. 제일의, 주된, 주요한 ② n. (학교) 교장 ③ n. (빌린 돈의) 원금
sentence1: His principal source of income was his salary./principal*_______________

sentence1: The primary purpose of insurance is the spreading of risks./primary*_______________

korean: a. 최고위의; 주된, 제일의 n. (조직·단체의) 장
sentence1: He has been appointed Chief Executive Officer of the company./Chief*_______________
translation1: 그는 그 회사의 최고 경영자로 임명되었다.

sentence1: Their financial support was crucial to the success of the business./crucial*_______________

sentence1: I don't really care about such trivial things./trivial*_______________

korean: v. 필요하다, 필요로 하다; (법·규칙에 따라) 요구[요청]하다
sentence1: This task requires a lot of practice, skill, and cooperation./requires*_______________s

sentence2: Some high schools require all students to wear school uniforms./require*_______________

korean: a. 몹시 필요로 하는[원하는], 필사적인; a. 절망적인, 자포 자기의, 될 대로 되라는 식의
sentence1: Millions of people are living in poverty and in desperate need of help./desperate*_______________

sentence2: The situation grew increasingly desperate and there did not seem to be any hope left./desperate*_______________

sentence1: An estimated 2 million people are in urgent need of food aid./urgent*_______________

korean: ① v. 의존[의지]하다 ② v. 믿다, 신뢰하다
sentence1: He can’t take care of himself. He relies entirely on his mother./relies*_______________es
translation1: 그는 스스로를 돌볼 수 없다. 그는 엄마에게 완전히 의지하고 있다.

korean: ① n. (아라비아) 숫자; 수치 ② n. 도형; (책 속의) 도표 ③ n. 사람의 모습; 몸매; (중요한) 인물 ④ v. (~ out) 이해[해결]하다, 알아내다
sentence1: The amount should be written in both figures and words./figures*_______________s

korean: ① a. 단 하나의, 단 한 사람의, 유일한; 독점적인, 단독의 ② n. 발바닥
sentence1: She was the sole survivor of the airplane crash./sole*_______________

sentence2: She is divorced and has sole responsibility for her children./sole*_______________

sentence1: The total cost has been calculated at three million dollars./calculated*_______________d

sentence1: The project will cost an estimated total of $500 million./estimated*_______________d

sentence1: This is such a large sum of money that few people can imagine the value./sum*_______________
translation1: 이것은 너무 큰 액수이어서 그 가치를 상상할 수 있는 사람은 거의 없다.

sentence1: It is much cheaper to buy in large rather than in small quantities./quantities*_______________es

sentence1: Geometry is the branch of mathematics that deals with shapes./Geometry*_______________

sentence1: The standard arithmetic operators are addition, subtraction, multiplication and division./arithmetic*_______________

sentence1: This formula is used to calculate the area of a triangle./formula*_______________

sentence2: The truth is that there is no magic formula for success./formula*_______________

korean: ① a. 적당한, 중간 정도의, 보통의 ② a. 온건한 n. 온건주의자 v. 누그러지다[뜨리다], 완화되다[하다]
sentence1: Even moderate amounts of regular exercise will lower your risk of heart disease./moderate*_______________

korean: ① a. (크기·수량·가격이) (그다지) 크지[많지, 비싸지] 않은, 보통의 ② a. (과시하지 않고) 겸손한
sentence1: Despite all these facilities, we charge a relatively modest fee./modest*_______________

sentence1: This course is designed for students at the intermediate level and above./intermediate*_______________

korean: ① n. 비, 비율 ② n. 균형
sentence1: In the city, a large proportion of old people live alone in their apartments./proportion*_______________

korean: n. (몇 대 몇 형식의) 비율, 비

sentence1: Her husband recently suffered multiple injuries in a car accident./multiple*_______________

sentence1: I’ve never seen such a multitude of birds in my life./multitude*_______________

korean: ① a. 대량의, 대규모의, 대중적인 n. 다수, 다량, 일반 대중 ② n. 큰 덩어리[무리]; (물체의) 질량 n. 떼 지어 모이다[모으다]
sentence1: There were masses of people in and around the station./masses*_______________es

sentence1: A few hours will not suffice; we need sufficient time to discuss it./sufficient*_______________

sentence1: The room was smaller than expected but adequate for our needs./adequate*_______________

sentence1: There is ample evidence that the fire was deliberately started./ample*_______________

sentence1: Africa is a continent that is abundant in natural resources./abundant*_______________
translation1: 아프리카는 천연자원이 풍부한 대륙이다.

sentence1: Slow down, you are exceeding the speed limit./exceeding*_______________ing

sentence1: Fresh vegetables are scarce at this time of year, so they're very expensive./scarce*_______________

sentence1: Most pregnant women are deficient in vitamin D./deficient*_______________

korean: v. 붓다, 부풀다, 부어 오르다; 증가[팽창]하다[시키다] n. (몸의) 불룩한 부분; 증가, 팽창
sentence1: Her ankle was beginning to swell and she could no longer dance./swell*_______________

sentence1: When the weather gets hot, bacteria multiply much faster./multiply*_______________

sentence1: Their political influence has diminished significantly since then./diminished*_______________ed

korean: ① v. (지속적으로) 줄어들다, 감소[축소]되다 n. 감소, 축소 ② v. (정중히) 거절하다

sentence1: The stock market plunged 608 points, the largest one-day decline in its history./plunged*_______________d

sentence1: If you subtract 90 from 150, you get 60./subtract*_______________

sentence1: We complemented each other well, despite our differences./complemented*_______________ed

sentence1: He supplements his income by selling books at a market./supplements*_______________s

korean: ① n. 규모 ② n. 저울; 눈금, (지도의) 축척, (측정용) 등급 ③ n. (물고기 등의) 비늘
sentence1: Production or import on a large scale reduces cost./scale*_______________

korean: n. 치수, 용적, 규모; (수학의) 차원; 차원, 관점
sentence1: To plan a space, you need to measure the dimensions of the room first./dimensions*_______________s

sentence2: Mobile phones have added a new dimension to communications./dimension*_______________

sentence1: They put an enormous amount of time into this project./enormous*_______________

sentence1: In the very center of the square stood a gigantic statue./gigantic*_______________

korean: a. 엄청나게 큰[많은, 센]; 굉장한, 대단한

sentence1: Canada is vast and occupies 41% of the continent of North America./vast*_______________

sentence1: I have an immense amount of work to do and a lot of projects underway./immense*_______________

sentence1: I knew there was a problem, but I just didn't realize the magnitude of the problem./magnitude*_______________

sentence1: Many astronomers and physicists assume that the universe is infinite./infinite*_______________

sentence1: They spent a considerable amount of money on advertising./considerable*_______________

sentence1: The government has invested a substantial amount of money in the project./substantial*_______________

sentence1: That day she was in bed with a headache and a slight fever./slight*_______________

korean: a. 꽉 들어찬, 조밀한, 소형의 v. 꽉[빽빽이] 채우다
sentence1: The bathroom was compact but well-designed so that it did not feel small./compact*_______________

korean: ① a. 극미한, 극히 작은 ② n. 분; 잠깐 (동안)
sentence1: All water contains minute amounts of salt./minute*_______________

sentence1: One feels difficulty in breathing at high altitudes./altitudes*_______________s

korean: ① v. 재다, 측정하다, 잰 수치가 ~이다 n. (도량의) 단위, 도량법 ② n. 조치, 대책
sentence1: This room measures 6 meters wide by 10 meters long./measures*_______________s

sentence1: The company is hoping to expand their business abroad./expand*_______________

sentence1: He had the picture enlarged because he was so proud of it./enlarged*_______________d

sentence1: The microscope can magnify objects up to one thousand times their actual size./magnify*_______________

korean: ① v. 더 늘리다, 연장[확대]하다; (~에) 이르다[달하다, 계속되다]
sentence1: They have agreed to extend the contract for another two years./extend*_______________

korean: ① v. 늘이다, 늘어나다; (지역·기간에 걸쳐) 뻗어있다, 이어지다 n. (길게 뻗은) 지역[구간], 일련의 기간 ② v. (팔다리를) 뻗다, 기지개를 켜다 n. (팔다리) 뻗기, 기지개
sentence1: The sweater has stretched and doesn't fit me anymore./stretched*_______________ed

sentence2: The farmland stretched out as far as the eye could see./stretched*_______________ed

korean: v. 오그라들다, 오그라들게 하다; 줄어들다, 줄어들게 하다
sentence1: The pants shrunk in the dryer, I can't even get into them./shrunk*_______________
translation1: 바지가 건조기에서 줄어들어서 나는 입을 수조차 없다.
sentence2: Since then, costs have risen and profits have shrunk somewhat./shrunk*_______________

korean: ① v. 수축[축소]되다[시키다] ② n. 계약(서) v. 계약하다 ③ v. (병에) 걸리다
sentence1: When you heat metal, it expands, and when it cools again, it contracts./contracts*_______________s
translation1: 금속에 열을 가하면 팽창하고 다시 식으면 수축한다.

sentence1: Compressed gas can be very dangerous and must be handled with care./Compressed*_______________ed

sentence1: We don't yet know the extent of the damage from this oil spill./extent*_______________

korean: a. 극도[극단]의, 극심한 n. 극도, 극단
sentence1: One out of every four people in the region lives in extreme poverty./extreme*_______________

sentence1: It seems to me that this is a matter of the utmost importance and urgency./utmost*_______________

sentence1: The situation is serious and we need to take drastic action immediately./drastic*_______________

sentence1: Although we speak on the phone, we seldom see each other./seldom*_______________

korean: ① a. 전적인, 완전한 ② v. 입 밖에 내다, 말하다, 발하다
sentence1: Oh, that's utter nonsense. Who says that?/utter*_______________
translation1: 아, 그건 완전히 헛소리입니다. 누가 그렇게 말합니까?

sentence1: Children of this age do not clearly distinguish between imagination and reality./distinguish*_______________

sentence1: Despite his age, he is still full of strength and energy./Despite*_______________

sentence1: At last the medal winners were announced in reverse order./reverse*_______________

sentence1: Contrary to popular belief, air travel is less dangerous than other forms of travel./contrary*_______________

sentence1: Other scientists have been unable to reproduce the results he reported./reproduce*_______________

sentence1: I'm now looking for a steady job with a solid company./steady*_______________

sentence1: Before money was invented, people bartered for things they wanted or needed./bartered*_______________ed

sentence1: Things aren't perfect yet, but recently a lot of progress has been made./progress*_______________

sentence1: Try to cultivate a positive attitude and apply it to everything you do./cultivate*_______________

sentence1: This letter refers to the conversation that we had on Aug. 2./refers*_______________s

sentence1: This topic is not directly relevant to our discussion here./relevant*_______________

sentence1: Today most computers are connected to the Internet./connected*_______________ed

sentence1: Punishment is most effective when combined with rewards./combined*_______________d

korean: ① a. 병든, 앓는 ② a. 나쁜, 유해한 ad. 나쁘게, 불쾌하게 n. 해, 해악, 불운
sentence1: She awakened with a high fever and was too ill to get out of bed./ill*_______________

sentence2: He was forced to resign because of ill health./ill*_______________

sentence1: He began to have heart problems and died of heart disease at age 40./disease*_______________

korean: ① v. 고통을 받다, (병을) 앓다 ② v. 겪다, 당하다

translation1: 그는 우울증과 다른 정신적인 병에 시달렸다.
sentence2: The city suffered severe damage from the powerful earthquake./suffered*_______________ed

korean: ① v. 회복하다, 소생시키다 ② v. 회복하다, 되찾다
sentence1: After a long illness, the patient recovered completely./recovered*_______________ed

sentence2: The global economy is beginning to recover from the crisis./recover*_______________

sentence1: She has been ill with flu for over a week./flu*_______________

sentence1: The disease is highly infectious and can cause serious illness./infectious*_______________

korean: ① v. 다치게 하다; 감정을 상하게 하다 a. 감정이 상한 ② v. 아프다, 아프게 하다
sentence1: He hurt his foot so badly that he couldn't walk./hurt*_______________

sentence2: Doctor, my arm hurts when I move it like this. What should I do?/hurts*_______________s

sentence1: He had serious head injuries and was taken to hospital./injuries*_______________es

korean: n. (흉기에 의한) 부상, 상처 v. 부상을 입히다
sentence1: Many soldiers were wounded or killed in the battle./wounded*_______________ed
translation1: 많은 군인들이 그 전투에서 부상을 당하거나 전사했다.

sentence1: He had a long, deep scar on the right side of his face./scar*_______________
translation1: 그는 얼굴의 오른쪽에 길고 깊은 흉터가 있었다.

sentence1: The car accident left him disabled and unable to do what he loved./disabled*_______________

sentence1: Young man, there's no need to shout, I'm not deaf./deaf*_______________

korean: a. 눈이 먼, 장님인 v. 눈멀게 하다
sentence1: He was blind from birth, yet he wrote music./blind*_______________

sentence1: The man has been deaf and dumb since birth./dumb*_______________

sentence1: He graduated from medical school at the University of Michigan./medical*_______________

sentence1: The physician examined him and took his temperature./physician*_______________

korean: v. 병을 고치다, 치료하다 n. 치유법
sentence1: It is a serious disease, but it can be cured by operation./cured*_______________d

korean: ① n. (내복)약 ② n. 의술, 의학
sentence1: Take this medicine three times a day after meals./medicine*_______________

sentence2: I’m studying medicine and hope to become a doctor./medicine*_______________

sentence1: The doctor told me to take two pills three times a day./pills*_______________s
translation1: 의사는 내게 하루에 세 번 알약 2개씩을 복용하라고 말했다.

sentence1: The drug has no side-effects and can safely be given to patients./drug*_______________
translation1: 그 약은 부작용이 없어서 안전하게 환자들에게 줄 수 있습니다.

sentence1: I got some medicine from a pharmacy this morning./pharmacy*_______________
translation1: 나는 오늘 아침에 약국에서 약을 샀다.

sentence1: John is a good friend of mine, but we have very different personalities./personalities*_______________es

sentence1: My son is addicted to computer games. He wants to do nothing else./addicted*_______________

sentence1: We tend to judge people by the first impression they make on us./tend*_______________

sentence1: His behavior toward her was cold and rude./behavior*_______________
translation1: 그녀를 대하는 그의 행동은 차갑고 무례했다.

korean: ① v. 대하다, 대우하다, 다루다 ② v. 치료하다
sentence1: We teach our children to treat older people with respect./treat*_______________

sentence2: These days, most health problems can be treated with drugs./treated*_______________ed

sentence1: His attitude made me very angry and disappointed./attitude*_______________
translation1: 그의 태도는 나를 매우 화나고 실망스럽게 만들었다.

sentence1: He didn't even have the courtesy to apologize for being delayed./courtesy*_______________
translation1: 그는 늦어진 것에 대해 사과하는 예의조차도 없었다.

sentence1: He is an evil man who only cares about money and power./evil*_______________
translation1: 그는 돈과 권력에만 관심이 있는 사악한 남자이다.

sentence1: She is really generous in giving help to the needy./generous*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 정말로 어려운 사람들을 돕는 데는 인색하지 않았다.

sentence1: It's not polite to yawn or look all around while someone is talking./polite*_______________
translation1: 누군가가 말을 하는데 하품을 하거나 두리번거리는 공손하지 못한 일이다.

sentence1: In our culture, it is rude to ask a lady her age./rude*_______________

korean: ① v. 응석을 받아주다, 버릇없이 만들다 ② v. 망쳐놓다, 버려 놓다
sentence1: His parents spoiled him by giving him almost anything he wanted./spoiled*_______________ed
translation1: 그의 부모는 그에게 원하는 거의 모든 것을 줌으로써 그를 버릇없이 키웠다.
sentence2: The continued heavy rain spoiled our vacation at the beach./spoiled*_______________ed

korean: ① a. 자랑스러워하는, 자랑스러운; 자부심이 강한 ② a. 거만한, 뽐내는
sentence1: She was proud that her daughter had received a good education./proud*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 딸이 좋은 교육을 받은 것을 자랑스러워했다.
sentence2: He was so proud that nobody liked him and he had no friends./proud*_______________

sentence1: She’s always boasting about how rich her family is./boasting*_______________ing
translation1: 그녀는 자신의 가족이 얼마나 부유한지를 항상 자랑한다.

sentence1: He was very arrogant and looked down on others./arrogant*_______________
translation1: 그는 매우 거만했고 다른 사람들을 업신여겼다.

korean: ① a. 겸손[겸허]한 v. 겸허하게 하다 ② a. (사람이) 비천한; (사물이) 보잘것없는
sentence1: He was always very humble about his success as a musician./humble*_______________
translation1: 그는 음악가로서의 자신의 성공에 대해 항상 매우 겸손했다.
sentence2: He was a man of humble birth but high ambition./humble*_______________
translation2: 그는 출신 신분이 비천했으나 야망이 큰 남자이었다.

sentence1: My mother was always very strict with us about table manners./strict*_______________

sentence1: He was too stubborn to admit that he had made the wrong decision./stubborn*_______________

sentence1: Your future will be bright if you have the courage to take risks./courage*_______________

sentence1: He was bold enough to steal a car right in front of the police station./bold*_______________
translation1: 그는 경찰서 바로 앞에서 자동차를 훔칠 정도로 대담했다.

sentence1: I was so frightened that I didn't dare go back to sleep that night./dare*_______________

sentence1: It is our moral duty to help our neighbors in need./moral*_______________

sentence1: Leaders must have high ethical standards./ethical*_______________

sentence1: Moral behavior is a matter of individual conscience./conscience*_______________

korean: ① n. 원칙, 주의, 신념 ② n. 원리, 원칙, 법칙
sentence1: It is against my principles to talk about people behind their backs./principles*_______________s

sentence1: The only solution is a frank exchange of views on both sides./frank*_______________

sentence1: I would like to express a sincere thank you to my hard-working staff./sincere*_______________
translation1: 나는 열심히 일하는 직원들에게 진심 어린 감사의 말을 전하고 싶습니다.

sentence1: She was afraid to tell him the truth, so she pretended nothing had happened./pretended*_______________ed

sentence1: He deceived her into believing that he really loved her./deceived*_______________d
translation1: 그는 그가 그녀를 정말 사랑한다고 믿도록 그녀를 속였다.

sentence1: He was caught cheating on an exam by his professor./cheating*_______________ing

sentence1: Corruption is widespread in most poor countries./Corruption*_______________

korean: ① a. 공정[공평]한 ② n. 박람회
sentence1: It's not fair that men get more attention and better jobs than women do./fair*_______________
translation1: 남자가 여자보다 더 관심을 받고 더 좋은 직업을 얻는 것은 공정하지 못하다.
sentence2: The Frankfurt Book Fair is held in October of each year./Fair*_______________
translation2: 프랑크푸르트 도서전은 매년 10월에 개최된다.

sentence1: Everyone trusts Jennifer because she is honest./trusts*_______________s
translation1: 제니퍼는 정직하기 때문에 모든 사람이 그녀를 신뢰한다.

korean: ① n. 믿음, 신뢰 ② n. 신앙(심)
sentence1: I still have faith in him. I'm going to give him a chance./faith*_______________
translation1: 나는 여전히 그에 대해 신뢰를 갖고 있다. 그에게 기회를 줄 것이다.
sentence2: His faith in God was the source and secret of his strength./faith*_______________
translation2: 그의 하나님에 대한 신앙심은 그의 힘의 원천이고 비밀이었다.

sentence1: He has always been a loyal supporter of the Democratic Party./loyal*_______________
translation1: 그는 항상 민주당의 충실한 지지자이었다.

sentence1: He betrayed his parents' trust by lying to them./betrayed*_______________ed

sentence1: Sigmund Freud is known as the founder of modern psychology./psychology*_______________
translation1: 지그문트 프로이트는 현대 심리학의 창시자로 알려져 있다.

sentence1: Many people make decisions based on emotion rather than facts./emotion*_______________
translation1: 많은 사람들은 사실보다는 감정에 근거해서 결정을 한다.

sentence1: I don’t know what I’ve done wrong but he’s in a bad mood with me./mood*_______________

sentence1: For Brazilians, football is not a sport, but a passion, almost a religion./passion*_______________
translation1: 브라질 사람들에게 축구는 스포츠가 아니라 열정, 거의 종교이다.

korean: n. 기쁨, 즐거움 v. 매우 기쁘게 하다
sentence1: The children screamed with delight when they saw the gifts./delight*_______________
translation1: 아이들은 선물을 보고 기뻐서 소리를 질렀다.

sentence1: My heart was so filled with joy that it seemed to me I was in paradise./joy*_______________
translation1: 내 가슴이 너무나 환희로 가득 차서 내게는 내가 천국에 있는 것 같았다.

korean: n. 스릴, 전율 v. 전율하게 하다
sentence1: Her powerful soprano voice thrilled the audience./thrilled*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀의 강력한 소프라노 목소리는 청중들을 전율하게 만들었다.

sentence1: Most Americans have an optimistic view of the future./optimistic*_______________
translation1: 대부분의 미국인들은 미래에 대해 낙관적인 견해를 갖고 있다.

sentence1: She’s very pessimistic about her chances of passing her exams./pessimistic*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 시험에 합격할 가능성에 대해 매우 비관적이다.

sentence1: She is never satisfied and always wants more./satisfied*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 절대로 만족하지 않고 항상 더 많은 것을 원했다.

sentence1: He was so disappointed at the result of the examination./disappointed*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 시험 결과에 매우 실망했다.

sentence1: Repeated failures drove him to despair./despair*_______________

sentence1: He called me and expressed his sorrow at my mother’s death./sorrow*_______________

sentence1: I would sometimes get so depressed that I wanted to end my life./depressed*_______________ed
translation1: 나는 때때로 너무 우울해져서 내 삶을 끝내고 싶어 하곤 했다.

sentence1: I've been so miserable since she went away./miserable*_______________
translation1: 나는 그녀가 떠난 이후 몹시 참담했다.

sentence1: I have no sympathy for anyone who drives drunk and hurts someone./sympathy*_______________
translation1: 나는 음주 운전하다가 누군가를 다치게 하는 사람은 누구도 동정하지 않는다.

korean: ① n. 불쌍히 여김, 연민의 정 v. 불쌍히 여기다 ② n. 유감스러운 일
sentence1: She pitied the boy for losing his parents at such a young age./pitied*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 그렇게 어린 나이에 부모를 잃은 그 소년을 불쌍히 여겼다.
sentence2: It's a pity that you can't come to the party tonight./pity*_______________
translation2: 당신이 오늘 밤 파티에 올 수 없다니 유감입니다.

sentence1: I really regret what I did; it was a stupid thing to do./regret*_______________
translation1: 나는 내가 한 짓을 정말 후회합니다. 그것은 바보 같은 짓이었어요.

korean: ① a. 자신하는, 자신만만한 ② a. 확신하는
sentence1: This experience made me more confident about myself and my abilities./confident*_______________
translation1: 이번 경험은 내가 내 자신과 내 능력에 대해 더 자신감을 갖게 해 주었다.
sentence2: He was quite confident that he would pass the exam./confident*_______________
translation2: 그는 시험에 합격할 것을 상당히 확신했다.

sentence1: He had liked her for years but was too shy to ask her out on a date./shy*_______________

sentence1: She was a timid child, and afraid of the dark./timid*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 겁 많은 아이여서 어둠을 두려워했다.

sentence1: You should be ashamed of yourself, look at what you've done./ashamed*_______________
translation1: 너는 네 자신에 대해 부끄러워해야 해, 네가 한 짓을 봐.

korean: n. 불명예, 수치 v. 명예를 더럽히다
sentence1: His behavior has brought disgrace on himself and his family./disgrace*_______________
translation1: 그의 행동은 자기 자신과 가족에게 수치를 안겨 주었다.

korean: ① a. 죄책감이 드는, 가책을 느끼는 ② a. 죄를 범한, 유죄의
sentence1: I felt guilty about not spending enough time with the kids because of my work./guilty*_______________
translation1: 나는 일 때문에 아이들과 충분한 시간을 보내지 못하는 것에 대해 죄책감을 느꼈다.
sentence2: Even if he is a murderer, he remains innocent until proved guilty./guilty*_______________
translation2: 비록 그가 살인자일지라도 유죄가 증명될 때까지는 여전히 무죄이다.

korean: v. 창피를 주다, 굴욕감을 느끼게 하다
sentence1: The teacher scolded and humiliated him in front of the whole class./humiliated*_______________d
translation1: 선생님은 반 전체 앞에서 그를 야단치고 창피를 주었다.

sentence1: I feel embarrassed when I see people kissing in public./embarrassed*_______________ed
translation1: 나는 사람들이 공공장소에서 키스를 하는 것을 볼 때면 당황스러움을 느낀다.

korean: ① v. 감정을 상하게 하다 ② v. 범죄를 저지르다
sentence1: I'm sorry if I've offended you. That's not what I intended./offended*_______________ed
translation1: 제가 기분을 상하게 했다면 미안합니다. 의도적인 것이 아니에요.
sentence2: Most of the prisoners started offending at an early age./offending*_______________ing
translation2: 그 죄수들의 대부분은 어린 나이에 범죄를 저지르기 시작했다.

sentence1: He felt insulted by the way he'd been treated./insulted*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 자신이 받은 대우에 모욕감을 느꼈다.

korean: ① v. 욕(설)을 하다 n. 욕설 ② v. 저주하다 n. 저주
sentence1: He cursed himself for his childish and immature behavior./cursed*_______________d
translation1: 그는 자신의 유치하고 미성숙한 행동에 대해 스스로에게 악담을 퍼부었다.
sentence2: In the story, a witch put a curse on the princess so that she would sleep forever./curse*_______________
translation2: 이야기 속에서 한 마녀가 공주를 영원히 잠자도록 저주를 했다.

korean: v. 눈살을 찌푸리다 n. 찌푸린 표정
sentence1: He shook his head and frowned at his own stupidity./frowned*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 자신의 어리석음에 고개를 내저으며 얼굴을 찌푸렸다.

korean: v. 마음을 뒤집어 놓다 a. 마음이 상한 n. 심란, 동요
sentence1: I was very upset about losing my job because I really liked it./upset*_______________
translation1: 나는 그것을 정말 좋아했기 때문에 직장을 잃고 마음이 매우 상했다.

sentence1: His father was furious about his bad manners and rude behavior./furious*_______________
translation1: 그의 아버지는 그의 나쁜 태도와 무례한 행동에 몹시 화가 났다.

sentence1: I often get annoyed by the smell of cigarette smoke./annoyed*_______________ed
translation1: 나는 담배 연기 냄새에 자주 불쾌해진다.

korean: v. 신경 쓰이게 하다, 괴롭히다 n. 성가심
sentence1: You look worried – is something bothering you?/bothering*_______________ing
translation1: 걱정이 있는 표정이군요, 무슨 괴로운 일이라도 있습니까?

korean: ① a. 불안해하는, 염려하는 ② a. 열망[갈망]하는
sentence1: He became more and more anxious as the war news worsened./anxious*_______________
translation1: 전쟁 소식이 악화되자 그는 점점 더 불안해졌다.
sentence2: He is anxious to get a job and become independent from his parents./anxious*_______________
translation2: 그녀는 취직을 해서 부모로부터 독립하기를 열망한다.

korean: ① n. 염려, 걱정 v. 염려시키다 ② v. (누구에게) 관련되다; (무엇에) 관한 것이다
sentence1: She was always concerned about her husband's health./concerned*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 남편의 건강에 대해 항상 염려했다.
sentence2: Don't get involved in what doesn't concern you./concern*_______________
translation2: 당신과 상관없는 일에는 개입하지 마세요.

sentence1: I had an uneasy feeling that something bad was about to happen./uneasy*_______________
translation1: 나는 뭔가 나쁜 일이 일어날 것 같은 불안한 느낌이 있었다.

sentence1: He was so nervous about his first speech that he couldn’t sleep./nervous*_______________
translation1: 그는 자신의 첫 연설에 너무 긴장해서 잠을 잘 수가 없었다.

sentence1: You’re looking very tense. Come on, try to relax./tense*_______________
translation1: 매우 긴장한 것처럼 보입니다. 자, 긴장을 풀도록 해보세요.

sentence1: I’m astonished that you don’t know the name of our President./astonished*_______________ed
translation1: 나는 당신이 우리 대통령 이름을 모른다는 사실에 매우 놀랐다.

sentence1: A sudden noise from somewhere in the house startled me./startled*_______________d
translation1: 집안 어딘가에서 난 갑작스러운 소리에 나는 깜짝 놀랐다.

sentence1: Most people have a fear of dying at some point during their lives./fear*_______________
translation1: 대부분의 사람들은 인생의 어느 시점에 죽는다는 공포를 갖고 있다.

sentence1: She was afraid of the dark, and always slept with the light on./afraid*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 어둠을 무서워해서 항상 불을 켜 놓은 채 잠을 잤다.

sentence1: There's no need to be frightened – the dog is friendly with people./frightened*_______________ed
translation1: 무서워할 필요 없어요. 그 개는 사람들과 친해요.

sentence1: Suddenly all the lights went out and they were very scared./scared*_______________d
translation1: 갑자기 모든 불이 다 꺼져 버리자 그들은 매우 두려웠다.

sentence1: Her husband's threats and violence terrified her at times./terrified*_______________ed
translation1: 남편의 위협과 폭력은 때때로 그녀를 두려움에 떨게 했다.

korean: n. 극심한 공포, 공항 v. 공포에 질리다
sentence1: She panicked when she lost her four-year-old son in the crowd./panicked*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 4살 된 아들을 군중 속에서 잃어버렸을 때 공포에 질려 어쩔 줄을 몰랐다.

korean: a. (사람이) 차분한; (바다 등이) 잔잔[고요]한 v. 가라앉다, 가라앉히다 n. 평온, 고요
sentence1: The storm soon passed and the sea grew calm./calm*_______________
translation1: 폭풍우는 곧 지나가고 바다는 잔잔해졌다.

sentence1: He put his arm around her to comfort her./comfort*_______________
translation1: 그는 그녀를 위로하기 위해 팔로 그녀를 감쌌다.

sentence1: She adored her grandson and took him with her everywhere she went./adored*_______________d
translation1: 그는 손자를 너무 좋아해서 그녀가 가는 어느 곳이든 그를 데리고 다녔다.

sentence1: He had become very fond of her and didn't want to see her leave./fond*_______________
translation1: 그는 그녀는 매우 좋아하게 되어서 그녀가 떠나는 것을 보고 싶지 않았다.

sentence1: I wanted to live in the city, but my wife preferred the country./preferred*_______________ed
translation1: 나는 도시에서 살고 싶어 했으나 내 아내는 시골을 더 좋아했다.

korean: a. 가장 좋아하는 n. 가장 좋아하는 것
sentence1: My favorite sports are baseball and soccer./favorite*_______________
translation1: 내가 가장 좋아하는 스포츠는 야구와 축구이다.

sentence1: He has a deep affection for his sons, especially his older son./affection*_______________
translation1: 그는 아들들, 특히 큰 아들에 대해 깊은 애정을 갖고 있었다.

sentence1: She turned and gave him a look of real dislike./dislike*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 돌아서서 그에게 정말 싫어한다는 표정을 보였다.

korean: v. 혐오스럽게 하다, 역겹게 하다 n. 혐오감
sentence1: Yuck! What's that disgusting smell? I feel sick./disgusting*_______________ing
translation1: 웩! 저 역겨운 냄새는 뭡니까? 구역질이 납니다.

korean: a. 마음 내키지 않는, 마지못해 하는
sentence1: He was reluctant to leave because he was having a good time./reluctant*_______________
translation1: 그는 즐거운 시간을 보내고 있었기 때문에 떠나고 싶지 않았다.

korean: n. 편견 v. 편견을 갖게 하다
sentence1: Women still face prejudice and discrimination in their daily lives./prejudice*_______________
translation1: 여성들은 일상 생활에서 여전히 편견과 차별해 직면해 있다.

sentence1: At that age children are curious about everything and ask many questions./curious*_______________
translation1: 그 나이에 아이들은 모든 것에 호기심이 많고 많은 질문을 한다.

sentence1: The children made so much noise, I couldn’t concentrate on my work./concentrate*_______________
translation1: 아이들이 너무 떠들어서 나는 일에 집중할 수가 없었다.

korean: v. 초점을 맞추다, 집중하다[시키다] n. 초점, 집중
sentence1: We need to focus more attention on this national problem./focus*_______________
translation1: 우리는 이 국가적인 문제에 대하여 더 많은 주의를 집중할 필요가 있다.

sentence1: The story-teller greatly amused the children with jokes./amused*_______________d
translation1: 이야기꾼은 아이들을 농담으로 매우 즐겁게 했다.

korean: n. 욕구, 갈망 v. 원하다, 바라다
sentence1: Almost everyone has a desire to succeed but all do not succeed./desire*_______________
translation1: 거의 모든 사람들은 성공하고자 하는 욕구를 갖고 있으나 모두가 성공하는 것은 아니다.

sentence1: The government is eager to attract foreign investment and technology./eager*_______________
translation1: 정부는 해외의 투자와 기술을 끌어들이기를 열망하고 있다.

sentence1: The king received an enthusiastic welcome from the crowd./enthusiastic*_______________
translation1: 왕은 군중의 열렬한 환영을 받았다.

sentence1: The moment she had a sudden impulse to cry./impulse*_______________
translation1: 그 순간 그녀는 울고 싶은 충동이 갑자기 들었다.

sentence1: My childhood ambition was to become a famous writer./ambition*_______________
translation1: 내 어린 시절 야망은 유명한 작가가 되는 것이었다.

sentence1: He always wants a bigger share than anyone else. He’s so greedy./greedy*_______________
translation1: 그는 항상 다른 사람보다 더 큰 몫을 원한다. 그는 매우 욕심이 많다.

sentence1: You never think about anyone but yourself. You’re so selfish./selfish*_______________
translation1: 너는 자기자신 이외에는 아무도 생각하지 않아. 너는 너무 이기적이야.

sentence1: He was filled with envy when he saw his neighbor’s new car./envy*_______________
translation1: 그는 이웃사람의 새 차를 보고 부러움이 가득했다.

sentence1: She gets incredibly jealous if she sees her husband talking to other women./jealous*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 남편이 다른 여자와 이야기 하고 있는 것을 보면 엄청나게 질투를 한다.

sentence1: He seemed to be completely indifferent to what was going on around him./indifferent*_______________
translation1: 그는 자신의 주변에 무슨 일이 벌어지고 있는지에 대해 완전히 무관심한 것처럼 보였다.

sentence1: She continued to ignore everything I was saying./ignore*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 내가 말하는 모든 것을 계속해서 무시했다.

sentence1: She began to drink and frequently neglected her children./neglected*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 술을 마시기 시작했고 자주 그녀의 아이들을 방치했다.

sentence1: He waved to attract the attention of the waiter./attract*_______________
translation1: 그는 웨이터의 주의를 끌기 위해 손을 흔들었다.

korean: n. 매력 v. 매혹하다, 마음을 빼앗다
sentence1: She seems able to charm any man she meets./charm*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 그녀가 만나는 어떤 남자라도 매료시킬 수 있을 것처럼 보인다.

sentence1: He was fascinated by her beauty and fell in love with her at first sight./fascinated*_______________d
translation1: 그는 그녀의 아름다움에 매혹되어 첫눈에 그녀와 사랑에 빠졌다.

sentence1: Advertisements tempt people into spending more money than they can afford./tempt*_______________
translation1: 광고는 사람들을 감당할 수 있는 것보다 더 많은 돈을 쓰도록 유혹한다.

sentence1: Football is probably the most popular sport in the world./popular*_______________
translation1: 축구는 아마도 세계에서 가장 인기 있는 스포츠이다.

sentence1: The company began to lose its reputation as a maker of high-quality cars./reputation*_______________
translation1: 그 회사는 고급 자동차 제조사로서의 명성을 잃기 시작했다.

sentence1: It's a well-known fact that the world is not flat./well-known*_______________
translation1: 세상이 평평하지 않다는 것은 잘 알려진 사실이다.

sentence1: Vienna is famous for its beautiful buildings./famous*_______________
translation1: 비엔나는 아름다운 건물로 유명하다

korean: n. 명성, 위신 a. 명성이 있는
sentence1: Within a short period of time, the orchestra has gained international prestige./prestige*_______________
translation1: 짧은 기간 동안에 그 오케스트라는 국제적인 명성을 얻었다.

sentence1: A lot of Hollywood celebrities were invited to the festival./celebrities*_______________es
translation1: 많은 할리우드 유명인사들이 페스티벌에 초대되었다.

sentence1: When I was young, my mother taught me to treat older people with respect./respect*_______________
translation1: 내가 어렸을 때 어머니는 내게 노인들을 공경심을 갖고 대하라고 가르쳤다.

sentence1: I admire his passion, and I admire him for not giving up that passion./admire*_______________
translation1: 나는 그의 열정이 존경스럽고 그가 그 열정을 포기하지 않는 것이 존경스럽다.

korean: v. 깊은 인상을 주다, 감명을 주다
sentence1: I was impressed by the depth of his knowledge and the breadth of his experience./impressed*_______________ed
translation1: 나는 그의 지식의 깊이와 경험의 폭넓음에 감명을 받았다.

korean: ① n. 놀라움, 경탄 v. 경탄하다 ② v.  ~인지 궁금하다, ~이 인가 하고 생각하다
sentence1: The Taj Mahal is one of the seven wonders of the world./wonders*_______________s
translation1: 타지마할은 세계 7대 불가사의 중 하나이다.
sentence2: I haven't heard anything from her for months. I wonder why./wonder*_______________
translation2: 나는 그녀로부터 몇 달째 아무 소식도 못 들었다. 왜 그런지 궁금하다.

korean: ① n. 영광, 명예 ~에게 영광을 베풀다 ② n. 존경, 공경, 경의
sentence1: Thank you, everybody. I am truly honored to receive this award./honored*_______________ed
translation1: 여러분 감사합니다. 이 상을 받게 되어 정말로 영광입니다.
sentence2: The ceremony was held in honor of those who died in the war./honor*_______________
translation2: 그 의식은 전쟁에서 숨진 사람들을 기리기 위해 거행되었다.

sentence1: I despise people who talk and do not act./despise*_______________
translation1: 나는 말을 하고 행동하지 않는 사람들을 경멸한다.

sentence1: It was just a joke. I was only teasing./teasing*_______________ing
translation1: 그건 농담이었어요. 그냥 장난으로 그런 겁니다.

sentence1: He was delighted when the teacher praised him for his efforts./praised*_______________d
translation1: 그는 선생님이 그의 노력에 대해 칭찬했을 때 아주 기뻤다.

sentence1: I knew he was only flattering me because he wanted something from me./flattering*_______________ing
translation1: 나는 그가 단지 내게서 뭔가를 원하는 게 있어서 아부를 한다는 것을 알았다.

sentence1: My parents congratulated me warmly on passing the examination./congratulated*_______________d
translation1: 부모님은 내가 시험에 합격한 것에 대해 따뜻하게 축하해 주셨다.

korean: ① v. 갈채[환호]하다 n. 갈채, 환호 ② v. 기운을 북돋우다 n. 쾌활함, 생기
sentence1: The whole audience cheered when the band came on stage./cheered*_______________ed
translation1: 밴드가 무대에 오르자 전 관중은 환호했다.
sentence2: He was cheered by a piece of good news he'd received this afternoon./cheered*_______________ed
translation2: 그는 오늘 오후에 받은 한 가지 좋은 소식에 힘을 얻었다.

sentence1: The audience applauded when the show was over./applauded*_______________ed
translation1: 관객들은 쇼가 끝났을 때 박수갈채를 보냈다.

korean: ① v. 감사하게 생각한다 ② v. 진가를 알아보다[인정하다]
sentence1: Thank you. I really appreciate your help and support./appreciate*_______________
translation1: 감사합니다. 도와주시고 지지해 주셔서 정말 감사합니다.
sentence2: His scientific abilities were not fully appreciated during his lifetime./appreciated*_______________d
translation2: 그의 과학적 능력은 그의 생전에는 충분히 인정받지 못했다.

sentence1: I'm so grateful to you for your kind advice./grateful*_______________
translation1: 친절하게 조언해 주셔서 너무나 감사합니다.

korean: v. ~의 탓으로 돌리다, ~ 책임으로 보다 n. 책망, 비난
sentence1: If your business fails, you will have no one to blame but yourself./blame*_______________
translation1: 당신 사업이 실패한다면 당신 자신 이외에는 누구도 나무랄 수 없다.

sentence1: She accused him of stealing her money and jewelry./accused*_______________d
translation1: 그녀는 그가 그녀의 돈과 보석을 훔쳤다고 그를 고발했다.

korean: ① v. 비난[비판]하다 ② v. 비평하다
sentence1: It's not right to criticize someone behind their back./criticize*_______________
translation1: 남을 뒷전에서 비난하는 것은 옳지 않다.
sentence2: We meet weekly to discuss and criticize each other's work./criticize*_______________
translation2: 우리는 서로의 작품을 토론하고 비평한기 위해 매주 만난다.

sentence1: His mother scolded him bitterly for breaking his promise./scolded*_______________ed
translation1: 그의 엄마는 그가 약속을 어긴 것에 대해 그를 심하게 꾸짖었다.

korean: ① n. 잘못, 과실, 과오 ② n. 결점, 단점, 결함
sentence1: Don't get mad at me, it's not my fault./fault*_______________
translation1: 내게 화내지 마세요, 그건 내 잘못이 아닙니다.
sentence2: For all his faults, Paul considered him a dependable friend./faults*_______________s
translation2: 그의 모든 단점에도 불구하고 폴은 그를 신뢰할 수 있는 친구로 여겼다.

korean: ① a. 책임이 있는, 책임을 져야 할 ② a. 책임을 지고 있는
sentence1: He is an adult and is responsible for his actions./responsible*_______________
translation1: 그는 어른이어서 자신의 행동에 대해 책임을 져야 한다.
sentence2: He is directly responsible for managing the day-to-day operations of the company./responsible*_______________
translation2: 그는 그 회사의 일상 업무의 관리를 직접적으로 책임지고 있다.

sentence1: He complained bitterly about the noise from upstairs, right above his bed./complained*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 그의 침대 바로 위의 위층에서 소음에 대해 심하게 항의를 했다.

sentence1: Thousands of demonstrators were protesting against the government's decision./protesting*_______________ing
translation1: 수천 명의 시위자들이 정부의 결정에 반대하여 항의를 했다.

sentence1: I can't forgive him for what he did to my daughter./forgive*_______________
translation1: 나는 그가 내 딸에게 한 짓을 용서할 수가 없다.

sentence1: Pardon me for interrupting you, but what do you mean by that word?/Pardon*_______________
translation1: 말씀하시는 데 끼어들어서 미안합니다만, 그 말이 무슨 의미죠?

korean: n. 구, 어구 v. (특정 방식으로) 말하다
sentence1: He used the phrase “creative society” several times in his speech./phrase*_______________
translation1: 그는 연설에서 “창조적인 사회”라는 어구를 어려 차례 사용했다.

sentence1: It is essential at the beginning to define the exact nature of the problem./define*_______________
translation1: 처음에는 문제의 정확한 본질을 정의하는 것이 필수적이다.

korean: ① n. 문맥, 전후 관계 ② n. 정황, 배경, 맥락
sentence1: It is often possible to guess the meaning of the word from the context./context*_______________
translation1: 문맥을 통해 단어의 의미를 종종 추측할 수 있다.
sentence2: Literature can only be understood in the context of a cultural system./context*_______________
translation2: 문학은 한 문화체계의 맥락 안에서만 이해될 수 있다.

korean: ① v. 뜻하다, 의미하다 ② v. 의도[작정]하다 ③ a. 심술궂은, 못된, 비열한
sentence1: She wasn't sure what the word meant, so she looked it up in the dictionary./meant*_______________
translation1: 그녀는 그 단어가 무슨 의미인지 확실치 않아 사전에서 찾아보았다.
sentence2: I’m sorry. I didn't mean it, it was just an accident./mean*_______________
translation2: 미안합니다. 고의로 그런 것이 아니고 그건 단지 우연이었습니다.
sentence3: Please don't be so mean to your little sister!/mean*_______________
translation3: 여동생에게 그렇게 심술궂게 굴지 마!

sentence1: His book became a best-seller and has been translated into many languages./translated*_______________d
translation1: 그의 책은 베스트셀러가 되었고 많은 언어로 번역되었다.

sentence1: He interpreted for her because she did not speak English./interpreted*_______________ed
translation1: 그녀는 영어를 하지 못했기 때문에 그가 그녀를 위해 통역을 해 주었다.

sentence1: He’s fluent in English and French. He also speaks a little Chinese./fluent*_______________
translation1: 그는 영어와 프랑스어가 유창하고 중국어도 조금 할 줄 안다.

korean: ① v. 발음하다 ② v. 표명[선언]하다
sentence1: Some English words are hard to pronounce properly./pronounce*_______________
translation1: 그녀의 이름과 같은 많은 중국 이름은 제대로 발음하기가 정말 어렵다.
sentence2: The court pronounced him guilty of stealing a car./pronounced*_______________d
translation2: 법정은 살인죄로 기소된 그 남자에게 유죄를 선고했다.

korean: ① v. 구술하다, 받아쓰게 하다 ② v. 지시[명령]하다 n. 지시, 명령
sentence1: He dictated to his secretary the speech he intended to give./dictated*_______________d
translation1: 그는 그가 하려고 하는 연설문을 그의 비서에게 받아쓰게 했다.
sentence2: You are in no position to dictate to me what you want./dictate*_______________
translation2: 당신은 당신이 원하는 것을 내게 지시할 위치에 있지 않습니다.

sentence1: The contract clearly specifies the rights each party has./specifies*_______________es
translation1: 계약서는 각 당사자가 갖고 있는 권리를 분명하게 명기하고 있다.

korean: n. 말, 발언, 언급 v. 말[발언, 언급]하다
sentence1: He made rude remarks about her physical appearance./remarks*_______________s
translation1: 그는 그녀의 신체적 외모에 대하여 무례한 발언을 했다.

sentence1: He mentioned the subject during one of his interviews./mentioned*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 한 인터뷰 그 주제에 관해 언급했다.

korean: n. 논평, 비평, 해설 v. 논평[비평, 해설]하다
sentence1: Analysts made negative comments on the company's outlook./comments*_______________s
translation1: 분석가들은 그 회사의 전망에 대해 부정적인 의견을 제시했다.

sentence1: Are you implying that he doesn't love me?/implying*_______________ing
translation1: 그가 나를 사랑하지 않는다고 말하려는 겁니까?

sentence1: She always emphasized the importance of education to her children./emphasized*_______________d
translation1: 그녀는 자식들에게 교육의 중요성을 늘 강조했다.

sentence1: The following is a summary of the official report on education./summary*_______________
translation1: 다음은 교육에 관한 공식 보고서의 요약이다.

sentence1: The police asked her to describe what the man looked like./describe*_______________
translation1: 경찰은 그녀에게 그 남자가 어떻게 생겼는지 설명해 달라고 요청했다.

korean: ① v. 명백히 보여주다 ② v. 시위 운동[데모]을 하다
sentence1: Flight attendants demonstrated how to use the life jackets./demonstrated*_______________d
translation1: 비행기 승무원들이 구명조끼 사용법을 보여주었다.
sentence2: More than one million people demonstrated against the war./demonstrated*_______________d
translation2: 백만 명 이상의 사람들이 반전 시위를 했다.

sentence1: Please remember to inform us of any changes to your personal information./inform*_______________
translation1: 당신의 신상 정보에 변동이 있는 경우 우리에게 통보하는 것은 기억하십시오.

korean: ① n. 통지, 통보; 안내[표지](판), 공고(문) ② v. 알아차리다 n. 알아챔
sentence1: You should give at least one month's notice if you want to move out early./notice*_______________
translation1: 조기에 이사하기를 원한다면 적어도 한 달 전에 통지를 해야 한다.
sentence2: There was a notice on the board saying the meeting had been cancelled./notice*_______________
translation2: 게시판에 회의가 취소되었다는 안내문이 붙어 있었다.

sentence1: The government has announced plans to create new jobs./announced*_______________d
translation1: 정부는 새로운 일자리를 창출할 계획을 발표했다.

korean: ① v. 선언[공표]하다 ② v. (세무서ㆍ세관에) 신고하다
sentence1: On December 11, 1941, Germany declared war on the United States./declared*_______________d
translation1: 1941년 12월 11일 독일은 미국에 선전포고를 했다.
sentence2: A customs official asked him if he had anything to declare./declare*_______________
translation2: 한 세관원이 그에게 신고할 것이 있는지 물었다.

sentence1: He proposed to her and she accepted his proposal./proposed*_______________d
translation1: 그는 그녀에게 청혼을 했고 그녀는 그의 청혼을 받아들였다.

sentence1: When we finished eating, I suggested that we go for a walk./suggested*_______________ed
translation1: 우리가 식사를 끝냈을 때 나는 산책을 하자고 제안했다.

sentence1: Could you recommend a good hotel in the center of the city?/recommend*_______________
translation1: 도시 중심부에 괜찮은 호텔 좀 추천해 주시겠습니까?

sentence1: You are requested not to smoke anywhere in the building./requested*_______________ed
translation1: 건물 안 어디에서도 흡연하지 않으시기를 요청 드립니다.

korean: ① v. 청구[요구]하다 n. 청구 ② v. 주장하다 n. 주장
sentence1: He sued the company and claimed damages of $2 million./claimed*_______________ed
translation1: 그들은 계약 위반에 대해 그 회사에 배상금을 청구했다.
sentence2: He claims he was there but I don't believe him./claims*_______________s
translation2: 그는 그가 그곳에 있었다고 주장하지만 나는 그를 믿지 않는다.

korean: ① v. (도움·지지 등을) 호소하다 n. 호소 ② v. (~의) 마음에 들다 n. 매력
sentence1: The government appealed for international aid for the flood victims./appealed*_______________ed
translation1: 정부는 홍수 피해자들을 위한 국제적인 원조를 호소했다.
sentence2: I just don't like her; she doesn't appeal to me as a woman./appeal*_______________
translation2: 나는 그냥 그녀를 좋아하지 않다. 그녀가 내겐 여자로서 매력적이지 않다.

korean: ① v. 간청[애원]하다 ② v. 구걸하다
sentence1: He begged her to come back, but she refused./begged*_______________ed
translation1: 그는 그녀에게 돌아오라고 간청했지만 그녀는 그에게 절대 돌아오지 않았다.
sentence2: The children had to survive by begging on the street./begging*_______________ing
translation2: 그 아이들은 길거리에서 구걸을 해서 생존해야 했다.

sentence1: The officer immediately commanded his men to fire./commanded*_______________ed
translation1: 장교는 즉시 부하들에게 사격을 명령했다.

sentence1: Speaking about eating habits, he counseled the students to avoid fast food./counseled*_______________ed
translation1: 식습관에 대해 얘기하면서 그는 학생들에게 패스트푸드를 피하라고 조언했다.

sentence1: Consult your lawyer before you make a decision./Consult*_______________
translation1: 결정을 하기 전에 변호사와 상담을 하십시오.

korean: ① n. 간단한 조언, 정보, 비결 ② n. 팁, 사례금 v. 팁을 주다 ③ n. (뾰족한) 끝, 첨단
sentence1: She gave me some useful tips on how to study for examinations./tips*_______________s
translation1: 그는 내게 시험에 대비해 공부하는 법에 대해 몇 가지 유용한 조언을 해 주었다.
sentence2: The service had been good, so they gave the waiter a big tip./tip*_______________
translation2: 서비스가 좋아서 그들은 웨이터에게 많은 팁을 주었다.
sentence3: She stood on the tips of her toes to reach the top shelf./tips*_______________s
translation3: 그녀는 맨 위의 선반에 닿으려고 발가락 끝으로 섰다.

sentence1: We normally meet once a month to discuss important issues./discuss*_______________
translation1: 우리는 중요한 문제들을 논의하기 위해 보통 한 달에 한 번 만난다.

korean: n. (격식을 갖춘) 토론, 논쟁 v. 토론[논쟁]하다
sentence1: There has been much debate over the introduction of a new tax system./debate*_______________
translation1: 새로운 세금 제도의 도입에 대해 많은 논쟁이 있어왔다.

sentence1: The policy has caused considerable controversy since it was introduced./controversy*_______________
translation1: 그 정책은 도입된 이후 상당한 논란을 불러일으켰다.

sentence1: I'm writing to inquire about language courses./inquire*_______________
translation1: 어학 코스에 대해 문의하고자 편지를 드립니다.

sentence1: I wrote him several letters, but he didn't reply./reply*_______________
translation1: 나는 그에게 여러 통의 편지를 썼으나 그는 답장을 주지 않았다.

sentence1: I asked him what was going on but he didn't respond./respond*_______________
